page.title: 07FORESTRY/BUILDINGS/PUBS
page.content: {FORESTRY 50% Woodland, birch, oak, pine, chestnut half of which is owned by the Forestry Commission. The wood is mainly used for fencing. In the grounds of Cumnor House School is one of the only two Chilean Conifers in the country. {BUILDINGS The council estate was built in 1945. Planning permission is virtually unobtainable apart from four houses built in between others. Many old houses are renovated. {PUBS There are two pubs; Crocadile in Danehill which is tenented and sells Charringtons and the Coach and Horses which is a free house.Bitter costs between 96p and 98p per pint (just under a pound for just over half a litre). Opening hours vary.
